org.vngx.jsch.cipher

Class CipherManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.cipher.CipherManager

  • public final class CipherManager
extends Object
    Manager for maintaining the AlgorithmFactory instance used to create instances of Cipher.
    Author:
    Michael Laudati
    See Also:
    AlgorithmFactory, Cipher

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cipher createCipher(String cipherName)
      Creates a new instance of the specified cipherName.
      Cipher createCipher(String cipherName, Session session)
      Creates a new instance of the specified cipherName for the specified session.
      static CipherManager getManager()
      Returns the singleton instance of the CipherManager.
      boolean isSupported(String cipherName)
      Returns true if the specified cipher name is supported.
      void setCipherFactory(AlgorithmFactory<Cipher> factory)
      Sets the AlgorithmFactory instance used by the manager to create Cipher instances.
      List<String> supportedCiphers(List<String> cipherList)
      Returns a list containing only the cipher names found in the specified cipherList which are supported by the manager.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getManager

        public static CipherManager getManager()
        Returns the singleton instance of the CipherManager.
        Returns:
        singleton instance

      • createCipher

        public Cipher createCipher(String cipherName)
                    throws UnsupportedAlgorithmException
        Creates a new instance of the specified cipherName. If the cipher is not supported, an exception is thrown. The method isSupported(java.lang.String) can be called to check if a certain cipher is supported without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        cipherName - to create
        Returns:
        cipher instance
        Throws:
        UnsupportedAlgorithmException - if cipher is not supported

      • createCipher

        public Cipher createCipher(String cipherName,
                           Session session)
                    throws UnsupportedAlgorithmException
        Creates a new instance of the specified cipherName for the specified session. Specifying the Session instance allows for custom logic for creating Cipher instances. If the cipher is not supported, an exception must be thrown. The method isSupported(java.lang.String) can be called to check if a certain cipher is supported without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        cipherName - to create
        session - to create cipher for
        Returns:
        cipher instance
        Throws:
        UnsupportedAlgorithmException - if cipher is not supported

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported(String cipherName)
        Returns true if the specified cipher name is supported. This method should not throw any exceptions; rather false should be returned if a cipher is not supported.
        Parameters:
        cipherName - to check if supported
        Returns:
        true if cipher is supported

      • supportedCiphers

        public List<String> supportedCiphers(List<String> cipherList)
        Returns a list containing only the cipher names found in the specified cipherList which are supported by the manager.
        Parameters:
        cipherList -
        Returns:
        list of supported cipher names

      • setCipherFactory

        public void setCipherFactory(AlgorithmFactory<Cipher> factory)
        Sets the AlgorithmFactory instance used by the manager to create Cipher instances.
        Parameters:
        factory - used to create ciphers in manager
